EVOR review of Sky Meet Sea

I got my first review for Sky Meet Sea. 10 stars out of 10. He says I'm headed for his top 25 list for this year. Ain't that something.

filed under Brave New World News Saga
NOV 15 2012

the death of a dream

this road that I have walked on all these years
does not exist. As if
the struggle was against nothing
shadows and easy promises
empty air and reflections
but no road to walk on.



this window I have stared through
for a full season of my life
has no purpose. There is nothing to see
on the other side, only
more of the same. It is not
as I imagined.



the only feeling I have
is that of drifting. Along
some corridor in my mind
that leads into soft madness
like a cloud of cotton
behind my nose



filed under Brave New World Journal Poetry Saga
OCT 30 2012

Sweet Thing from Sky Meet Sea

This (Sweet Thing) is my first single from the new album. I wrote it years ago but it only got produced for Sky Meet Sea so here it is finally. Buy the whole album at AxelRadio for only $4.



Produced by Krister Axel, mixed by Scotty Lund. Enjoy!



filed under RockstarAlley
OCT 16 2012

Somewhere from Sky Meet Sea

This (Somewhere) was also recorded at the Village Studios in Santa Monica. Love that place. Horn part written by the amazing Bill Dowling. Somewhere - a very simple song that I think was produced beautifully (if I do say so myself).





You don't want to be
alone in a storm with me
you don't want to be
lost at sea with me



you might love me
you might care
you might need me
somewhere



you don't want to be
chasing stars with me
you don't want to be
hiding your heart from me



you might love me
you might care
you might need me
somewhere



somewhere, somewhere
you might need me somewhere
